2023-06-22 Rogge, Vinay:

Has to be refined as time specific for IMU.

text: It shall be possible to flash the components simultaneously in the system.
supplier_comment:
If flashing of IMU3 shall happen via IMU2 (via IDC Satellite),
it can not run parallel to the flashing of IMU2 (due to the needed routing functionality)

text: If components prevent while be flashed other components being flashed, the supplier shall immediatly communicate to customer.
supplier_comment:
If flashing of IMU3 shall happen via IMU2 (via IDC Satellite),
it can not run parallel to the flashing of IMU2 (due to the needed routing functionality)

text: 3-Diff shall be supported if OFR not required.
supplier_comment: OFR is required, therefore 3-Diff will not be supported

text: Several flash partitions are to be provided
Shadow Mode software shall be flashed via the standard flash access & standard flash infrastructures.
supplier_comment:
Not applicable as per 1512679, From current Point of View, support of shadow mode is not required for components
other than IDC.

text: The customer is requested to share the technical details with Daimler if there are further requirements for diagnostic and / or flashing.
supplier_comment:
Not applicable as per 1512679, From current Point of View, support of shadow mode is not required for components
other than IDC.

text: At least, identification information (e.g. part numbers) for shadow mode application shall be provided via diagnostics.

Not applicable as per 1512679, From current Point of View, support of shadow mode is not required for components
other than IDC.

text: The requirements of this chapter are valid for all flash reprogramming procedures, independend of the type of datablock (bootloader, application, data).
supplier_comment:
2023-06-30  Rogge:
This will be evaluated with every requirement of this chapter.

text: Reprogramming of a diagnostic instance must be possible independently from the actual clamp-state (ISW_STAT).
If the reprogramming-attempt is aborted (e.g. lost of connection to tester), the diagnostic instance must detect the abortion.
supplier_comment:
2023-06-22 Rogge, Vinay:
When reprogramming is aborted, bootloader will detect it and control will stay in boot mode.

text: If an abortion is detected the diagnostic instance must immediately be ready to be reprogrammed again without any special investigation (like clamp30-reset).
If clamp30 is lost while reprogramming of the diagnostic instance, the diagnostic instance must be reprogrammable without any special investigation if clamp 30 is available again.
supplier_comment:
2023-07-04 Rogge, Vinay:
 Acutal clamp state is not applicable but Network message is considered instead to keep IMU running.

2. Number of reprogramming attempts is 1000 (see ID 1437257)

text: If the bootloader recognises an incompatibe software/ hardware combination, the diagnostic instance must stay in bootloader-mode an must not start the application-software.
supplier_comment:
2023-07-03 Rogge, Vinay:
According meeting on 2023-06-30 status set to "to clarifay".

2023_08_11 Neves: (Answer from MB): HW-SW compatibility check. Current decision is not to implement it as only 1HW variant is planned for series. If HW changes are needed in series production which leads to HW-SW incompatibility, then this topic should be reconsidered.

text: The implemented mechanism must be agreed by the customer.

If a change of application-software or component-hardware leads to new incompatibility, the supplier must inform Minerva.
The change must must be agreed by the customer.
The supplier must deliver an overview listening all compatible software-/hardware-combination with any new released application-software and any new released hardware.
After reprogramming of the diagnistic instance the error-memory (chrono-stack) must be erased.
supplier_comment:
2023-06-20 Vinay, Rogge:
The error memory (Diagnostic Chrono Stack ) is a non-volatile memory. So, this will not be erased with Reprogramming.

text: Learn and calibration values shall not be erased, but it shall coordinated between customer and supplier which values although shall be resetted to default.
supplier_comment:
2023-06-27 Rogge:
Initial functions like  learning and calibration are not implemented (see also DNG Module SW ID 2005712). Therefore this requirement is not applicable for IMU.

text: CRRRS4242E This content cannot be exported because it contains malformed text or hyperlinks.

2023-06-29 Rogge, Vinay:
Only variant coding and calibration data are applicable on IMU.

text: CRRRS4242E This content cannot be exported because it contains malformed text or hyperlinks.
The bootloader shall be flashable via normal communication interface.
Flashing the Bootloader shall be done via Standard customer tooling.
A supplier specific tooling for flashing the bootloader can be used, in this case, the supplier shall provide this tooling to the customer.
supplier_comment:
2023-7-05 Rogge:
No specific Tooling is used, Monaco Tool is used. Not applicable -> not agreed

text: Abort of Bootloader flashing process shall not brick the component.
In case of flash process abortion, reflashing shall be guaranteed.
Incompatible bootloader software with hardware shall avoid flashing the bootloader.
supplier_comment:
2023-07-03 Rogge, Vinay:
According meeting on 2023-06-30 status set to "to clarifay".

2023_08_11 Neves: (Answer from MB): HW-SW compatibility check. Current decision is not to implement it as only 1HW variant is planned for series. If HW changes are needed in series production which leads to HW-SW incompatibility, then this topic should be reconsidered.

text: If incompatibilities between bootloader and hardware occur, the hardware shall be exchanged (or updated internal, if applicable) by the supplier at the own expense.
For all reprogramming scopes, the security requirements which are described in own modules shall be also taken into account.
supplier_comment:
2023-03-07 Rogge:
Requirements according evaluation in the following DNG modules: Debugging Interfaces Security, Flashware Encryption, HSM Requirements, IMU Security, Penetration Testing, Rollback Protection, Secure Boot, Security Information)
